revised_title: Effects of Blood Letting and Cold on Blood Coagulation
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the effects of blood-letting and cold on blood coagulation. They discovered that blood coagulation can be altered during blood-letting and that cold can promote coagulation. The author suggests that blood-letting should be done more frequently into small cups to better understand its effects on blood coagulation and that cooling the body may be beneficial in stopping hemorrhages.
